Reviews.Title: “Loved everything except the STREET NOISE”
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, staff, location, food, ect. My only complaint is the street noise. The windows are old and need to be upgraded to doubled pane glass; if not triple. So if you are easily bothered by outside noise or are a light sleeper this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cool boutique choice for downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jenniferck1
Reviews.Content: Loved the vibe of this hotel, had a very slick urban feel that would be appreciated by design aficionados. Yes, it was fairly noisy on the 4th floor overlooking the street, but to be expected in an entertainment district and it added to the overall vibe. Check in was very friendly and personalised. Loved the real espresso machine in the room, a real find considering how difficult it is to get real espresso in the States. Only disappointment was that the included breakfast wasn't provided, but I was fairly happy with just the coffee anyway. Not suitable for prudes or people wanting a standard hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Middle aged "hip couple"”
Reviews.Author: maureen v
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was clean and the bed was very comfortable, however what good is the comfort of the bed if all you can hear starting at 9 or so is the very very loud music from down below, and you cannot fall asleep.There is a pub right next door. Drums beating actually vibrated the bed. We did move to the other end of the hotel but it did not make any difference. Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: tuck3621
Reviews.Content: The Keating is a beautiful hotel in a great location with helpful, friendly staff. Everyone went out of their way to ensure that I had a great stay and I even found myself spending time chatting to the desk staff instead of going back to my room, which is always nice when you're traveling alone. As someone who like to work hard and play hard, their bar and club recommendations were much appreciated. Thanks Cindy and Tricia! This is the first time that I have felt compelled to make a point of telling the desk staff how much I loved the place and my time there. I was also fortuitous enough to get upgraded to one of their best rooms upon arrival which definitely made for the most incredible stay. I will certainly be staying at The Keating the next time I'm in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Best for couples looking for a night out, not so good for anyone else”
Reviews.Author: LMNT
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great on most accounts - clean, amazingly helpful and friendly staff, great amenities in the room (flatscreen TV, bose sound system, espresso machine), prime location in the heart of the gaslamp... however, based on the room i stayed in, this isn't the best hotel for friends or family. The room is designed so that the shower has no door and faces INTO the room. so if you don't like whoever your in the room with staring at you naked, maybe choose a different hotel. The lighting was also really dim, not so great for girls getting ready to go out. The "double" rooms come with two twin beds, not two double beds like typical american double rooms. These were the only negatives, other than that, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Poor property. don't let their decor fool you!”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: front desk staff, rude and arrogant, as was management. Customer service is something they need work on. Check your sheets, they are likely stained! Ask the roaches, they will tell you about the stains. Hope that you are sick during your stay because the mildew stain, is terrible. Oh and dont take the elevator, you get charged a fee for doing so! Those that still decide to book enjoy your stay in your bathroom with a bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anamgarcia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Gaslamp distrit. If you want to find nice restaurants, bars and clubs this is the perfect place! The room is big, with a very confortable bed. You have a coffee machine to use free of charge. The staff is very nice and helpful. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs insulation”
Reviews.Author: 2Profs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Keating because of a Travel Zoo coupon that we purchased for $239. which included a 2 night stay and one dinner. We were told that this represented a $500. plus value. The first disappointment when we arrived was being told by Valet staff that parking would cost $32. per night. This was not printed on the coupon nor at the website, so having arrived late in the evening and being unfamiliar with the local parking garages, we opted to use the valet service. We were shown to a very small room on the 4th floor. We knew that the decor had a unique, urban style, but we were disappointed that there was no table or chairs in the room, apart from the bed, wall desk, and desk chair under the windows. Mostly, we were unprepared for the constant noise which we heard from the bars and clubs surrounding the hotel. This went on until 2 AM., followed by construction sounds, busses, garbage trucks, and raucous street people below our windows, which were closed. Needless to say, we did not get any sleep. We requested a room change in the morning but were told that the only room left was the penthouse (at a $30) surcharge directly above our room. We declined and checked out and relocated to the delightful Bay Club and Marina on Shelter Island. Check out my review for same, which will be much more laudatory than this one! In the future, we will check out the Travel Zoo "deals" more carefully before we commit. I should mention that the staff at the Keating delivered "service with a smile" and was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couple in love”
Reviews.Author: kbinsb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location, with the Gaslamp District literally outside your door. It's steps away from a multitude of choices in fine dining, clubs, bars, coffee houses, ice cream shops and so forth. Our room had concrete floors, which we liked just fine. The shower is frosted glass, with no door and in the corner of the room. If you're shy, this might not be your first choice. The room comes stocked with a high end CD player, an iPod player, a flat screen TV and so forth, none of which we used. It also has a simple to use espresso maker. Loved that feature and used it daily. The staff is fabulous. They're happy and caring. We'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Please read: Staff was great but I would recommend going somewhere else for an extended stay.”
Reviews.Author: SDONATRIPAGAIN
Reviews.Content: I was there for 12 nights at the Penthouse floor. It is what most would consider an extended stay and so I feel this review should be considered before selecting this hotel. It's gonna be a long one but all events are truthful none exaggerated. I feel the information provided will be helpful. I work hard and play hard traveling throughout the world and so every few months I like to make the best of my vacations at all costs. I usually take 3 wks each time always go back to San Diego for a week or so being I have properties there and my toys and I like to check up on those things every few months. This recent vacation I took I went away to San Diego for 12 nights and then to The Dominican Republic for 13 days. (DR is a great place I highly recommend it) This review is directed towards those that like to "Live A Little" and really like to enjoy your vacation or getaway without worries. I'm throwing in the star to the staff. My compliments to the staff you deal with personally. Four people that stuck out in my mind as great were Andra, Brandon, I believe the gentleman's name is parker sorry if I messed that up, and the other young lady that helped me secure information on bottle service at the hottest night clubs in Downtown San Diego the last weekend I was there. Kudos to you all. The noise and other things others have complained about didn't bother me after I put on my earplugs being I knew what I was getting into as I read the reviews. Not a problem there. If in San Diego depending on the season I stay at The Gas Lamp or Mission Beach. Being I stay at the Gas Lamp anyways this location was as good as others not OMG status as the reviews may say. I liked the room and cleanliness. The Housekeeping did an excellent job throughout my stay. I did make sure I called everyday on my way out though just in case not because it was necessary. My complaint about the room though is that because of the concrete floor it can get very cold. Be aware of that I'd prefer rug as it is more cozy but again this wasn't something I didn't know about just thought I would remind those as the cold will get colder :) My two biggest complaints were the food and parking. Not so much the taste of the food though one night I ate at the restaurant downstairs and for an Italian place I though it would be more authentic and tasty. I'll give them the benefit of doubt and say that maybe it was the plate I ordered never the less I wasn't convinced and so I didn't return. I will say that at the restaurant the service and the wine were great. Of course at cost ;) All in all it is a classy place and a nice environment. I did eat at the other option many times at The Keating and have to say I found it humorous. I like to think that most of the hotels I've chosen before are bigger with their own kitchens etc and so when I order something from my room at of course a higher price than I would get it down the street it usually comes fresh, crisp lettuce, tomatoes, cuts, made to order etc. Hey nothing agains room service I always get it I understand demand meets supply and yes I'd like for it to be prepared for me and delivered thank you ;) Well at The Keating, if you order from your room one not knowing would think the kitchen has received a call, your order placed, a slip has been created, cutting and dicing is now taking place. Actually, the items on the menu that are not served during the restaurant hours. Everything else like pizza, sandwiches etc that is not a la carte comes from this average, sandwich shop around the corner where the sandwich items are already cut and exposed, sandwiches and pizza prepared in a display case waiting for your call so that the "chef" can take it from the display box and toss it in the oven for a crisp toasty sensation ;P I found that humorous as once I learned that was the case my not so fresh 20 dollar pizza or 14 dollar sandwich were much more acceptable being if I walked downstairs myself I would only have to pay 6 bucks and get a free drink vice delivery chargers for something already there :) I mean it wasn't going to taste any different if I ordered it from the room or not. Again... just trying to enjoy each meal to the fullest while on vacation here not so much. My other disappointing experience was the Hotel's parking I own two custom American Classic Cadillacs. A 1962 Cadillac Coupe DeVille and a 1966 Cadillac Coupe DeVille Convertible. These are no clunkers over 40k has gone into the customization and restoration of the 66 and about 20k to the 62. In other words. Everything is working as it did then or better on the vehicles. Attached are pictures. This is where The Keating fails. Their parking is not managed by hotel staff. It is ran and managed by ACE parking staff. They've set up a large booth structure closest to the street in front of the hotel. They park public vehicles that pull up in search of parking for a night out in town etc. Here is where the personal relationship and responsibility that one would get at any hotel when handing the keys over to valet is LOST. THE FEAR is that ACE parks your vehicle at The Horton Plaza parking this plays into the fear that your rental, new sports car, classic, or car with valuables is exposed in public to not enough security, numerous floors of cars backing up, driving in and out independently potentially damaging your vehicle, or a crowded weekend with one or two thieves. Not to mention the lack of attention to detail by the arrangement of parking on The Keating's part. THE NIGHTMARE: Where it fails is this valet finds themselves in a hurry running back and forth a block or two to park vehicles and try to attend the next customer to get a dollar or a tip that your car which you entrusted to valet was never really looked after or considered in the first place. They really didn't care. I asked the hotel staff to please make sure the car was parked under a roof. The answer was our parking compound is underground so I don't see why it wouldn't be. I said okay thank you but please make sure it is. "No problem sir we will" again this is where the lack of attention to detail and responsibility turned into an issue and could to you. If it happened to my vehicle a luxury classic car, a real looker, that gets compliments everywhere, people want to take pictures by it or of it, and is nothing but appreciated by the public. Why shouldn't it happen to the average luxury car you worked so hard for? On my second or third night it got cloudy and rained for two days/nights. Earlier before the rain I had given my car to valet. Two nights/3 days later I was up downstairs early and asked for my car to begin my day as there was business I needed to attend to and the rain had cleared. I'm then asked to go help assist in turning on my car. Here is where I discovered the dirty little secret about the parking. Not only was my car nowhere near the hotel but they parked it on the outside lot of the Horton Plaza The reason was that the dual batteries were drained being the lights were left on at the time of parking. So somebody turned on the lights, drove my car away, parked it and walked away without bothering or look back to catch the lights left on. Not even a security guard saw it to notify the ACE staff. It was left unattended and unsupervised long enough to drain two Optima performance batteries. This is where it really got ugly. Not only was the car not parked in the structure it was parked by the street and sidewalk, the lights left on, but the windows where NEVER ROLLED UP. So that morning I walk up to my car and when I open the doors the mats on the floor are covered in water, the carpet is a mush, the seats are wet and I am forced to get a jump after of course I move the knob to the off position with the big letters that read "LIGHTS." I was a bit upset when I found a note inside the car that said. "Found at so and so time, on date (was two nights before) with the windows open and car unlocked. Must lock vehicle to secure items. Please call SDPD at 619-531-2000 if items are missing" One of the hotel staff was shocked as he stood in front of what was a detailed car when I brought it in was now dirty, tree leaves, and soaked inside was just left out there for days/nights. He was shocked he offered the hotel to pay for the detailing. I welcomed the gesture and they did pay for it when I received the car days later but for me what was now a day of business turned into a day of taking it to the shops I've taken them to out of my own pocket to check for water damage under, and in the upholstery etc. I had to leave the car for a detailed inspection and detailing for four days. Fortunately there was no damage found at the time, of course we all know how moisture is to a 45 yr old classic. Of course this took away from me using the car on vacation with the top down on sunny days out around San Diego visiting friends and family as those are the things one looks forward to when far away from home. I was very kind to the men and women of the hotel. Even under It was not their fault as it is the managements responsibility to oversee the subcontracted companies work. When I returned this is where management made a choice to make the guest feel unwelcome. John Tso-etc should not be in charge of the high caliber men and women mentioned at the beginning of my review. My advice would be to learn something from the names listed above in guest relations and service.Upon my return with another car Management the name had directed to the hotel staff to not accept any vehicle that needed valet. So instead I was forced to drive a block or two away and park the vehicle myself at the Horton Plaza walk back to my hotel room to have to repeat the same in the morning when I started my day. The embarrassing part was with a guest and I pulled up to valet only to find out that they would not accept my car so I had to ask her to wait on the street as I had to go up two block inside the horton plaza to park my car. Inconvenient and definitely not welcoming. Was it me that chose to park my car or any car in the street away from secure parking leaving the lights on, doors unlocked on rainy days without even checking up on it to realize the lack of attention to detail? No it was not. It was not fair to me a guest that stayed over for an extended period of time to be treated that way. Especially being that every day after the 4th day that I parked my own car and went back and forth myself I was still charged the 30 something dollars for "valet service" and I was the one doing all the work. I could have gone a few blocks further and parked it for 15 dollars a day or even 20 at another spot but staying at the Gas Lamp and having two walk 2 blocks away from your hotel is long enough. Don't get me wrong all the ACE employees were not all bad there was a girl who was kind and a gentleman by the name of Raymundo that was very helpful towards the end of my stay and though I was notified by the hotel staff to park it myself and get it myself Raymundo really wanted to provide a service to the guest. That effort alone was worth a 20 dollar tip given to him for trying ;) John maybe during your working hours being the car was out there for 3 days not to say you have to do it on your free time. Since you are part of management maybe you should do a drive through, or walk through in the hotel and verify the quality of service being provided to your guests or to you from the companies you contract to take care of a service to the customer. I wasn't just someone coming in for a weekend. I was someone actually living in, actively using the minibar, restaurants, amenities and services the hotel had to offer. I've stayed at numerous hotels downtown for extensive stays as this to name a few The W, Marriot, US Grant, Hard Rock, The Andaz formerly the Ivy. It is because of these stays and experiences that I can say The Keating cannot compete with those other luxury names in the Gas Lamp area. Especially not with the actions mentioned taken by management. My recommendation to you is to choose another name if you really want that catering to you, extended friendly stay, that we all pay for in high end hotels. Hey you are only on vacation every few months or only get a chance to get away so often. Make the right choices and you will enjoy your time there :)

Reviews.Title: “Stylistic but not so functional”
Reviews.Author: pankakes8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom on a two night voucher through Travelzoo, and for the price we paid, it was a good deal. The hotel was definitely visually stunning, and the rooms were interesting to say the least, with a streamlined design and great amenities like a phone charger and mini-fridge. Beyond the style, however, there were several discomforts, like a cement floor, two twin beds as opposed to full or queen size, and an open shower in the room. The hotel is also right above a jazz club, which played live music until about 1am, keeping us up pretty late. The included breakfast was disappointing-granola came with melon in it, which I've never seen before, and blackberry yoplait yogurt. To avoid paying the $35 valet parking fee, we parked in a local lot for $20. On the other hand, however, the staff was extremely accomodating and friendly, and gave us a bottle of wine when we arrived. We also ate at the hotel's restaurant, Merk, which was delicious; I would recommend eating there even if you're just in downtown San Diego. Overall, it was good to experience, but I don't think I'd make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “earplugs required”
Reviews.Author: davereino
Reviews.Content: Great hotel good location walking distance to everything. Great staff. cool different room types. If your looking for peace and quiet dont stay here. If your looking to stay out until 2am. and party this your kind of place. Food at the Merk was excellent. Breakfast in bed each morning was a pleasent surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sage_travel888
Reviews.Content: I had bought a two night voucher through Travelzoo in early in the year and made reservations later in the year. Unfortunately, we couldn't make the weekend we booked it for. We waited so long for this weekend! The person who answered the phone was a bit snooty and unsympathetic to my situation. I understand that we have to forfeit the voucher when we change the reservations less than 14 days in advance, but I think they could have made an exception if they really wanted to, considering that I booked this almost a year in advance. Then she had the audacity to say that they hope we stay with them next time. Yeah, right. No thanks. I received an email from Travelzoo saying that my voucher was used within minutes of hanging up the phone with the hotel. Talk about not wasting any time. Geez where's the compassion....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: eyeforservice
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was impressed before arriving by both their website and by the pre-arrival message I got. They have lifestyle concierges that help arrange anything you like. I'm fact, they arranged an amazing birthday dinner experience for my girlfriend at Cafe Sevilla. The room was phenomenal. High ceilings, modern decor but with the infusion of classic elements like brick, and natural elements like a rock garden with live cactus. The rain shower with no doors was very cool. Hip music playing when you arrive. The chais lounge and other seating by the windows made it easy to people watch 5th street. And they have a chic lounge and restaurant too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely go back. We literally didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “There is just so much to LOVE there....”
Reviews.Author: Cheyenne333
Reviews.Content: My husband Jason & I were greeted with a abundance of greetings and they made us feel like Royalty. They made us feel like family and that we were the only two people that mattered. We have tattoos and usually dont get the best of service do to stereotypeing from most hotels since we have been on our trip this place stands out above the rest, in all fashions . From the service to the fashion decor to the beautiful women who even carried our lugggage for us. Thankyou very much we will be back. ps my husband said to say except the big charges for the juice but that was offly worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great”
Reviews.Author: BuySellAZHome
Reviews.Content: Loved the Staff. My dtr especially loved the hotel dog. Location was great. walking distance to anything. rooms: very modern -- really did not like having my bathroom area (toilet was enclosed) open to the whole room. Really gave you NO privacy for showering. Really only set up for two people per room. We had 2 adults and 2 kids. Kids had to sleep on a blow up bed. NOISE: location of the hotel is right next to several bars. Thus partying noise till 3 am -- Bars close a 2 yet by the time people get moving down the street ... Stayed two nights - had relatives with us staying in two other rooms. They had band noise for the same time. The only fix was the sound machine they had by the bed. The second night that seems to help sleep though the craziness. Peeked out the window part of the night and saw crazy man half clothed climbing up on the cross the way signs. Beds were soft --

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure What the Attraction IS”
Reviews.Author: DonQZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and didn't enjoy much of it. Front desk staff friendly, but absolutely no follow through on requests. We didn't have washcloths two of the days, and after reporting this to the staff were told they would bring them after the laundry service was delivered (we had clean towels; do they send washcloths out separately?). Never happened. Staff very proud of custom coffee machine, but we only had one pod of regular coffee each day, even after we asked for more. Also proud of slippers for cold cement floor in room, but they didn't exist, either! We found out on last morning we should have had order forms for daily complimentary breakfast. Very stressful and disappointing. They really need to get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxepr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at the hotel and really enjoyed the hotel! Very friendly staff and cozy rooms. Very quite rooms, clean and great value. Beds are very soft and comfortable! Night time turndowns with homemade treats was a surprise! Free breakfast delivered to the room in the morn. was nice! Showers are very roomy with washcloths! High dollar HDTV and stereo system was rare these days in a hotel. The location is perfect, plenty of places to eat and drink in the Gaslamp district. Close to the airport and warf. All the attractions are walking distance and the hoop on hoop off bus is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing Service & Dog Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaWN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in October. We were running late (as our dog sitter flaked) and so I called and asked if I could bring the dog for one night, they were so accommodating and said they were dog friendly and it wasn't a problem. In addition they put a little dog bed in our room and left some dog treats. They even called their restaurant to let them know we were running late and to hold our table. The staff was SO nice, especially Parker who wouldn't accept a tip for bringing us breakfast and was so helpful with our dog needs. In addition the location is right in the heart of bars, clubs and restaurants in San Diego. The rooms can get a little loud since you are in the middle of the ruckus but they have very nice furnishing and a very cool, modern look. We had a great time and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: michaelkathleen58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Keating hotel San Diego, this place was in the heart of the the Gaslamp Quarter, the staff were very nice and friendly. Croce's was located right next door, great food. We were there when they had the blackout in San Diego on the 8th of Sept. The hotel had flashlights and bought in food for the guest from the Merk a restaurant that is associated with the hotel. This place is nice for the price. You won't be disappointed, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: twincitizen
Reviews.Content: Where are rhe washcloths? The open showers are a hazard. Noisy and cold. Poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: gridchick73
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a weekend here in June. We loved the unique / modern look and feel of the room with the concrete floor, in-room shower, and eletronic ameneties including a nice TV and Bang Olefsen sound system. The staff was very friendly and helpful, our room service breakfast was scrumptious, and our dinner at the Merk was fabulous. This is a great place for couples to stay in a great location in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nosiest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Rostan1
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days there on a great tarvel zoo deal. Great location in the heart of the gas light district. Great friendly staff. This an 1890 building that was refurbished as a hotel by the Italian designer firm of Pninfarina. It has funky room decor, ie, no floor carpet (painted concrete), shower consisted of 2 slabs of vertical glass in the bedroom, no reading lights on night table, etc. Parking for guests was $32/night. WORST of all, we were initially on the 2nd floor directly over Croce's restaurant. The LOUD music didn't stop until 1AM and it was impossible to sleep. After that came the street noises that you couldn't previously hear because of the loud music. the next morning we asked to be moved. We were moved up one floor to an inside room. Now we only heard the booming of the drums; but we heard them until 2AM(?) because it was Saturday night. Unless you are a total night person or can fall asleep while in the middle of a rock concert this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Beautiful Decor. Not for the light sleeper though!”
Reviews.Author: Celeste R
Reviews.Content: I went there on the weekend of the 5th. The staff was incredibly nice and accomodating. The decor of the building and in the room was beautiful. The only problem? Between the hours of 10 p.m. and 3:00 a.m. you won't sleep if you get a room with a street view. We're talking LOUD. Like, radio blasting in your room loud. You can literally feel the vibrations of the music move the furniture. They do provide earplugs for this very reason, but those things are so uncomfortable... at least for me. My husband who normally sleeps through everything agreed that it was pretty bad. That's pretty much the only flaw to this place. Maybe they should invest in soundproofing the windows/rooms?

Reviews.Title: “never got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: albert c
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 8th & 9th of Aug. 2011 The decor was goddy & uncomfortable. When arriving the music was loud and to trendy. Paid for 2 breakfast on each morning to be delivered by room service. On the 8th, breakfast was 30 or 40 min late causing us to miss the satrt of our tour( luckily the tour company moved ou to the next departure) On the 9th, after waking me at about 7am, to confirm what I had ordered.The breafast never arrived even after I called twice. Dinner at,The Merk,was superbly presented and was delicious. The only objection was the 20%added to the check without my consent. The management refused to adjust the bill for missed meals.Also they charge $32 pre day parking which i wasn't infomed of until I checked in and lastly the noise level from outside was terible. went on till 3 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Trevor-EDM
Reviews.Content: The Keating hotel is located in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter. This is good for those who want easy access to all the pubs/clubs/restaurants/shopping (Horton Plaza). It's a short cab ride to the airport (10 minutes - $10-$15) and within walking distance to the Coronado Ferry, Trolley system (for use around town or to head to Las Americas outlets), USS Midway and other attractions. The rooms are exactly as described - modern and chic. They use Bang & Olufsen for their audio/entertainment systems and have a great LaVazza espresso machine. The bed is very comfortable. The shower in our room was in the corner of the room and completely open to the room. Obviously this type of hotel is not for anyone who has a problem with that. There is noise from the street during the night/morning so if you are a light sleeper you may want to consider other hotels outside of the Gaslamp Quarter. We were on the 4th floor and it was still a little noisy. We had no problems sleeping through the noise, but I can see why others would. Each floor had models of cars designed by the company that designed the hotel. The hallways and common areas were kept in great condition. The elevator is slow, however it can be overlooked since it is steam powered and the oldest in San Diego. We experienced the famous pastries during turndown service and they were a delicious touch. I just wish they had come every night! Check-in/check-out went smooth and without issue. Be aware you'll pay $3/night for a historical fee. Overall it's a great hotel and I would not hesitate to stay there again. It's not a family oriented hotel though (because of the shower and such), so if that's your situation you may want to consider elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but noisy”
Reviews.Author: LSEROTA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two young adult sons stayed in two rooms across the hall from each other. Concrete floors, open showers and roll-out closets were all very cool. Espresso machines in each room were a nice touch. Bed was comfortable but our sons' room faced the street and was right above a nightclub, which kept them up until about 3:00 a.m. We were there for Comic Con, so the location was terrific. There is definitely a reason they supply earplugs as one of the free amenities in the rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible Motelish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: therealjackio
Reviews.Content: Ok, I don't even quite know where to begin. We stayed at the Keating because they said they would accommodate our bachorlette party. I got a separate room from the party because I wanted to sleep that night so I was across the hall from the larger party with 3 in my room. From the minute I got there the room was very uninviting and not comfortable at all. I love modern design and even owned a mid-century home but not a smart idea for a 100 year old building. Who's idea was it not to have carpet in a vintage hotel where the insulation between rooms is terrible and the windows are single pane. No carpet and no drapes equal a very noisy room and boy did I find that out at 6 am in the morning when road construction started and I had earplugs in and it felt the workers were in my bed! I first thought it was trash being picked up but it went on that loud until we checked out. HORRIBLE NOISY ROOMS! I won't even go into the over pretentious design of the rooms and they were not even ergonomically comfortable. The showers are glass with a 3 foot opening (not good for the shy but this wasn't my issue) they were COLD! Between the opening of the glass and the trendy shower head 5ft directly above you it was a very uncomfortable shower. When we came down the stairs with the bachorlette party they were shushing us as we were leaving the hotel and telling us we better not be loud when we got back from going out, really rude attitudes. Lastly, we were there for the weekend so my girlfriend who stayed in my room, we both got valet parking ($35 a night btw). When we checked out in the morning we told them we were leaving our cars for the night and they told us it would be a charge for every night and we said fine. Here is the clincher: My girlfriends car doesn't start right away and they thought it was out of gas so they left it in the street. I came back in the middle of the day around 2pm and the valet Joanna told me about it and said it was no problem that the only thing it would be in the street until we picked it up. I said no problem and asked profusely if it was going to be ok in the street, She replied " ya, it will have a Ace sticker in it so no one will bother it" She never mentioned , not once, that it had to be picked up by 5pm. I never asked because I told the front desk we were leaving our cars another night to stay with friends. Well, 10:30pm rolls around and thats when they decide to call me to tell me they are towing my friends car away in 30 minutes or less. At this point I was in bed and did not get the phone call so my friends car did get towed away. Are you kidding me, we leave a car for valet and it gets towed away by the HOTEL! Why didn't they start calling me at 5pm when I was awake and I could move it but they waited until we were both asleep miles away. The next day we went back to the hotel and Joanna told me that she told me it had to be picked up by 5pm and this is not true at all. I had another friend with me and both of us know she did not tell us it had to be picked up by 5pm. Well, here is the REAL KICKER! We picked the car up from the tow yard and the tow guy was like, "this car's not out of gas, I drove it off the truck" Are you kidding me. We paid our $315 and she proceeded to drive it a few blocks away to a gas station. It was low but NOT out of gas. Of course no one immediately at the premises of the hotel could help me so I had to call on Monday to talk with Christos Brooks. He wasn't there so I left a message explaining the whole thing. Christos NEVER called me back so I had to call him back again the next day. He told me that he was aware of the story and that we were terrible guest and we smoked in the room (which btw I did leave the room for a bit and I think someones smoked in my bathroom so I did not complain the next morning and quietly paid the $200 fee) and we did not deserve any compensation and we were terrible guest and he was not going to do anything about it and we could take it up in court if we wanted. All I can say is this hotel did everything wrong, from the badly designed rooms, poor customer service and then the manager didn't even return my call to hear what I had to say the next day. Bad business all the way around and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone even if you have a coupon for 50% off, go stay at Motel 6, I think you will get a better night of sleep and its probably decorated more comfortable. A big thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniGiammarco
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous time! Fabulous location! Very sexy! Can't wait to come again! The espresso machine in the room made my mornings SO much easier :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but decor was a bit "un-cozy" for us.”
Reviews.Author: Chiennoir3
Reviews.Content: Best aspects of the hotel: friendly staff & very pet friendly. In mix of Gaslamp bar scene=club downstairs is thumping late into the night (there are ear plugs provided & there is a bar next door with down and out seeming people drinking early in the morning (no issues with them, just kind of a sad scene). The hotel is largely red inside - red walls, red carpet, red bed spreads - creating an edgy vs. relaxing feel, which included a shower without a door that was in the corner of the room so you'd be on display for your (hopefully admiring) roomie. We were also right next to the maid's room=a loud metallic clanking of her door in the morning. And my personal pet peeve - being charged for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattmac101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the July 4th weekend here. We loved the uniqueness of the room, concrete floor, open floor plan, hi-tech amenities. Breakfast was very tasty and our dinner at the Merk was very good, along with the service. Our only complaint was the noise from the street.Our room faced the street, which on a Sat. night noise on Saturday night was very noisy. The next night we put the radio on and listened to the ocean which helped drown out the street noise. The other thing which I would have liked is to have more of a lobby and to have a pool. Other than that, the staff was excellent. Very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for Couples”
Reviews.Author: knowlc099
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as a getaway for the weekend. We were pleasantly surprised. The staff is extremely friendly and is always willing to help. The hotel is very clean and they provide a wonderful turn down service with a different dessert every night specially prepared by the chef. It can be a little noisy at night but it isn't something that takes away from the charm. The beds and pillows are the most comfortable I have ever had at a hotel. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This made our wedding anniversary so special”
Reviews.Author: djacobsss
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we felt pampered and cared for. The historic hotel building is a work of art. The room is modern and chic, lots of surprises, and not your ordinary hotel. This hotel truly gives meaing to the name "boutique hotel". You have to experience it. Ultra modern TV, DVD, CD and Spa music alarm clok. All hotel amenities are 1st class. The location of the hotel Keating is right in the center of the action in the Gaslamp quarter of San Diego. Just next door to Croces, a block away from the Hard Rock., steps away from the Horton Plaza and Seaport Village. You just park your car, and leisurely see the sites. This was a memorable anniversary get away. We are planning on making this a yearly jaunt to celebrate this milestone in our life. Some very special people work to make your stay enjoyable. I would highly recommend this boutique hotel to all of my friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “UNIQUE AND BEAUTIFUL, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Pompougnac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is Unique, no other word to describe it. Converting an old structure into a design icon was a job well done here. I liked the colors, the gadgets, the FREE espresso machine, the free slipers, the shower was great, and the room was huge. I coudnt hear any street noise at all. The bathroom was somewhat of the downside, but all and all, it was just great to be walking distance to everything in the gaslamp district. Trisha at the front desk was great and helpful, and their restaurant, the Merk, whas really good. Every evening they leave a small dessert from the chef at your room.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, best staff..”
Reviews.Author: mojaan
Reviews.Content: Its a contemporary icon in San Diego, loved it so much. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern. The staff are the best we had in our 4 destinations trip to the US. They are knowledgable, helpful and so friendly. The location is perfect its in the middle of the lively neighborhood of Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ehben36
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel on a Monday and the staff were extremely happy to see us. The hotel check in might be bright red, but it was extremely efficient and friendly. The cold water fountain with lemon and strawberries was a nice touch. We were upgraded straight away and enjoyed the Penthouse. Awesome shower, super comfy bed, and one of the nicest pillows I've ever slept on. Turnover was a delight, as was the little cookies. Would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys a stylish stay and wants to be in the middle of San Diego. Only disappointment - the elevator! It's the oldest in San Diego and takes a while to get to the top. But it's historic so we'll forgive it... A must stay in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique bang in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Mos01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Imperiale suite and the first thing I noticed about the place was the Jacuzzi tub and the Bang & Olufson sound system. The Jacuzzi tub is really nice and the changing lights added a nice touch. It took me a while to understand the working of the sound system and I am a tech capable person. One problem is that they should wire up the entire system - living room and bedroom together, so one can play music throughout the suite. You cannot also play a dvd in the bedroom but the on demand movies make that redundant to a certain extent. One suggestion to the hotel would be to provide a written manual next to the sound system so that guests understand how to operate it! Front desk was extremely helpful and even showed us to our room and offered to help with everything. They were also quick in addressing any issues. When we mentioned we were celebrating graduation, we were sent a card congratulating us with our complimentary champagne. This was a truly personal touch and I really appreciated that. The bathroom showers are heavenly but it is open and transparent so might not be appropriate for non-partners. The toilets have one sliding door so that can be uncomfortable to some travelers in groups. The bed was really comfortable and with the music allowed me to sleep at night. Be warned about the noise though. I was duly informed that the noise can get a bit loud. But blame it on Friday night and the reveling San Diego clubbers, it was a bit too loud. Had fun going up and down the oldest (and possibly slowest :-)) elevator in town. The decor is rich, the suite nicely spaced out. Expresso machine is good, in room bar is well stocked. The hotel mascot Smudge is such a cutie, had fun playing ball with her. The hotel restaurant Merk lived up to our expectations despite reviews to the contrary. We took the suggestions of the server and were quite satisfied with the food and the decor. Valet parking is expensive but expected, but the Horton parking lot is right across the road so you can say a few bucks on that (I was lazy!) All in all, this place is a great experience. It is possibly one of the most convenient locations in downtown. Get your ear plugs, a few nice swigs of champagne, hit the Jacuzzi for a while and you should be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Fun and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my girlfriends. Standard room had 2 double beds, see through shower with no door and concrete floors. (Felt a little like a very modern, tricked out dorm room). This was ok for us, but I wouldn't want to stay here with someone I wasn't really comfortable with. The staff here was awesome. Super nice at the front desk, they couldn't be more helpful with dinner and bar recommendations, and getting us taxis. The magic bars at turndown time were also a nice touch. We were here for a weekend of drinking and having fun, so we were not overly bothered by the noise. Like the other reviews say, this hotel is in the middle of all the action -- it is a very very noisy hotel. Lots of noise on the street from the bar scene, and garbage pick up early Sat morning. Ear plugs didn't really help. I would come back again for the same sort of party weekend. I would not stay here if one had expectations of a restful weekend. I would also try to get a suite/room with king beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: conorod
Reviews.Content: This hip restaurant is in a great central location. Room are modernly designed. Only downside is the street can get a little loud.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: JKW7
Reviews.Content: Why? Because the historic elevator is so loud, kept us up along with the inability to keep the room cool. The shower is in the room so there is NO privacy. I had asked about this when I made our reservation and was assured the bathroom was separate. Our room faced another building and we felt so closed in! The service was fair and the hotel really offers few amenities for the price, the espresso machine and high tech electronics don't make up for it. A small airpot with marginal coffee is inside the front door. My stay was supposed to include a take along breakfast which was never offered....when we asked they tossed a few things in a bag (one day!). The wake up call system was not working properly so we came very close to missing our early am flight.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: This is a hip and different hotel, for sure. It's decked out in Ferrari red everywhere. The room has industrial concrete floors and no separate bathroom. If you are traveling with a "friend", beware. The shower is in the bedroom, with clear glass. The front desk service was good, but the valet system is terrible. They park cars in the parking garage of a nearby shopping mall so it takes forever to get your car. And valet parking is NOT cheap. I would not recommend this hotel for a "vacation" or an extended stay. It would be fun and interesting for a couple of nights, but after that it would get annoying. But it is in the middle of the Gaslamp, so food and drink is on your doorstep. Because of the location, and the reasonable price, I would be back if I needed a place for a night. But I would look elsewhere if I was in town for much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Great Hotel. Great Fun Location”
Reviews.Author: Lospanchos
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego so I don't usually stay in San Diego hotels. However, I had the opportunity to view the Keatings rooms when they first opened and I always wanted to pay a visit. Last Friday, my wife and I spent the night at the Keating and had dinner at The Merk (The Keating's restauraunt). The restaurant was fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The hotel was also great. I won't try to describe the rooms. Look at the pictures online at the Keating's website. The rooms are different that any other hotel I have ever seen. There are only 35 rooms in the hotel. The staff knows their guests and treated us very well. The locatioin in the heart of the Gaslamp was perfect. I know some people have complained of street noise. We did not have any problems with noise. The next time we need a getaway from the kids, we will return to The Keating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chic Property!”
Reviews.Author: CandaceB74
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this property! Great location, amazing staff and customer service! The rooms are very spacious and well appointed. Located within walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joshua1215
Reviews.Content: Took my finance down there for her 27th birthday and we both loved it!! What an amazing time. The service was fantastic and they were so pet friendly too!! Our dog had their own dog bowl and treat service. Really a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Great, hip place to stay for a night on the town. Staff was great”
Reviews.Author: dtap2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my wife's birthday and loved it!. Exposed brick, high ceilings, comfy linens / bed, and an amazing shower. Staff was super friendly -- lit votive candles in the room while we were at dinner to surprise my wife. They pulled our car around without asking after our wake up call based on a comment I had made our early departure. (You should know that there is a lot of street noise on weekends, particularly after the bars let out)

Reviews.Title: “Planned this for my company as our hotel and man did I recieve flak for it”
Reviews.Author: ciampetti
Reviews.Content: Would never stay here again. 1: Rooms are tiny 2: floors are concrete 3: 2 nights our rooms were never made up 4: everyone in my group was overcharged, we had to fight all these charges and finally we gave up 5: showers are clear glass with an open door and our in the corner of the room so there is no privacy 6. So bad the second to last day ended up leaving and paying for the night anyways 7. Was here for business but stayed for a vacation too and very glad I left the hotel to stay elsewhere 8. Fitness center is an elliptical (a joke) I can't stress enough how terrible this hotel is. It really ruined the first half of my trip. I still get made fun of at work for picking it. The only plus was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: annemurphey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. They renovated a very old building giving it very distinct clean lines and a very contemporary feel. Very chic, down to the very last detail, and a great downtown San Diego location. We felt like celebs staying at this hotel, an absolutely great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Trvl4Sanity
Reviews.Content: If you're an American suburbanite that likes chain restaurants and planned communities, this hotel is probably not for you. It has nothing in common with a Marriott or Hyatt, yet it is the hotel that chains and boutiques alike aspire to be. Europeans have an uncanny ability to take a historic space and create a model marvel, and the Keating illustrates this tradition impeccably. Upon arrival, I was greeted by a lovely young lady that actually showed me to my room and provided me with a tour of the hotel, which includes an internet lounge and gym. The gym left something to be desired (no treadmill), but honestly, the hotel is in San Diego, not Minnesota, so if you really want to exercise, you can go outside and run or walk any time of the year. The Keating has so much character and the styling and details are unparalleled. For example, the in-room lighting is controlled by remote control; each room contains an espresso machine; turn down service includes decaf espresso and homemade cookies; and the sound system is Bang and Olufson. I could go on and on, but perhaps it’s better not to reveal all the delectable details as it was a pleasure to discover them on my own. I will end with one recommendation – order room service from the MerK. The scent of the risotto with scallops made even the non-seafood-eating hotel clerk hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkrealestate
Reviews.Content: I stay in A LOT of hotels worldwide. This place was really amazing. Not only was the decor really cool, the rooms large and clean with super comfortable beds and room amenities, but the service is what put it over the top for me. Many boutique hotels these days have super chic decor like this one, but the service is what sets them apart and creates the memory. The font desk folks were amazing friendly, courteous and professional. They met every need and seemed more than happy to do it. They actually seemed like they loved their job. The location for downtwon is perfect. There is no better Gaslamp location right in the heart of everything. I used the laptop lounge and the meeting rooms, which were brick walled and had the most recent technology. The restaurant was a great value, great food and again great service. I highly recommend this hotel. I have recommended it to my friends and will return next time I'm in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish yes, but Unfortunately Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: evanembee
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been remodeled very nicely, the location is excellent, and the interior is as swank and stylish as you'd expect from an Italian auto manufacturer. While the hotel is quite old, none of its original charm was retained. Unfortunately local historical preservation requirements demanded that they retain San Diego's oldest operating elevator (seriously). We've stayed in lots of boutique hotels, and actually prefer older preserved/remodeled ones, but we have never had an experience like this. The steam-driven elevator mechanism positively roars and shudders the rooms, making sleep impossible. The hotel's solution -- complimentary earplugs and a white noise machine -- work well enough, but for these prices and the boutique hotel experience Keating aspires to, it's quite a disappointment. Add to that the malfunctioning toilet in our room that went unrepaired, despite our numerous requests, for our entire 4 day stay, plus a massive screw-up of our reservation by the otherwise charming and eager staff, and we can't possibly recommend this place. (I should note that as "amends" for our experience we were given a coupon for two slices of pizza somewhere, and the manager removed the historical preservation tax from our room charge.) To sum up, the hotel is superficially glitzy and swanky and fashionable, and the staff tries hard to please, but the guest experience leaves a lot to be desired. There are many lovely options in San Diego; go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, high style and design, very Italian!”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend, and LOVED it... after staying one night at the Sofia (they were sold out the rest of the weekend), we stayed in two rooms (they were sold out of different room types, so we gladly moved around), 4B and Penthouse G. 4B was nice, in a quiet location away from the street... beds were amazing. Penthouse G was an incredible treat, with an amazing modern tub that could fit three people, a giant separate living room and bedroom area, etc., etc. Just simply amazing - we felt like rock stars! The views of the city were amazing too. The Penthouse did have some street noise, but that's what's to be expected when you're right on 5th Avenue in the heart of all the action! The rooms are all decked out with amazing sound systems and tvs and high end cappuccino/espresso machines, etc. The service was also incredible... we were recommended a restaurant, Chopohn (?), and it was in-cred-i-ble! One of the best meals I've had in years! The only thing I'd change about these rooms is that I'd add carpet tiles to the floors instead of the uber-modern floors they currently have. Stay at The Keating if you want an amazing high-style experience, and if you want to impress your other half... or that special someone you meet during your visit to San Diego! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: hotellover13
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed, to say the least, with my stay at the Keating. I can say we will NEVER stay again. I expected so much more since I had heard some good things about this hotel. My first impressing was that the lobby was the smallest I had ever seen. My husband and I went to San Diego for the weekend with my Brother and Sister-in-law for her birthday. We picked the Keating because they had a great deal of 30% off if you book 2 nights. When my sis-in-law booked the room she picked the least expensive room, but stated it was for her birthday. When I booked I upgraded the room for a better view. We checked in together and they upgraded her to the same kind of room as mine, but on the penthouse level since it was her birthday. When I mentioned we were all together and maybe we could ride on her birthday coat tails to the same level they just laughed as if I was joking! I brushed it off and we were put on the third floor with a view of the city. The rooms are industrial looking, but I knew that from the pictures. Concrete floors and brick walls. What I didn't know was that the bathroom is not in a separate room. Only the toilet is private. The shower is in the bedroom with no door so there is no privacy and it is cold when you turn off the water. Most likely due to the concrete floors. Once in our room I noticed it was hot so I turned up the air, but it didn't seem to work. The bellboy told us to give it 5 minutes to cool off. It never cooled off. I tried to call the desk, but the phone was busy for 15 minutes. I tried to iron my clothes, but the iron wouldn't work. I called the main number from my cel phone and got through to the desk. The same bellboy came with the new iron and asked if I had put water in the iron first. Since when do you have to put water in the iron in order for it to work??!! It's not a steamer! Anyway, he put water in the new one and said to give it 5 minutes to warm up. I though, "What is with this kid and his 5 minutes?" I asked about the phone being busy and was told they had been very busy up front. I waited for the iron to heat. The light was on, but no heat. My husband pressed the "settings" button, the light went off, and it worked!! Shouldn't they have been able to tell me that?! We went to dinner and out to the clubs (the location is perfect). Upon return, the room was still hot. I called the desk, but the phone was busy! Still??? I guessed there must be something wrong with our phone. I traveled downstairs to the front desk and was told the hotel was green so the air turns back on with a sensor when you enter the room. I told her it never got cool earlier and we had currently been in the room over 5 minutes. They found another room, on the penthouse level. However, the room was smaller with a view of the taller building next door that was almost close enough to touch! When I asked about a view room they said they had one across the hall, but it was even smaller. At this point it was already 2:30 in the morning, the room was cool and it was quiet. The city side is very noisy since the building is old and so are the windows. So, we stayed put. I went to use the universal charging station in the room to finish charging my iphone, but that was the only broken plug! I was given alot excuses that irritated me and no one ever offered to reduce my room rate since I was downgraded to a view of a wall and alley because their air and phone was broken. When I checked out I waited for someone to ask if I enjoyed my stay or if everything was okay, but no one did. I'm not one to complain too much, but I am a regular weekend traveler, who will not be a returning customer when dissatisfied. There are too many nice hotels in San Diego for me ever to want to go back to the Keating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... HORRIBLE customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Barcelona2night
Reviews.Content: I was pleased when we pulled into the Keating... it has a great location in the gaslamp district and is stunning. The posh rooms and comfortable bed were well received. It was loud, but nice enough not to care. However, the staff was awful. Just about anything that could go wrong went wrong. We called and asked for ice (as you are supposed to do) but never received anything. We called and asked for a wake-up call, but never got one. When we went down to the front desk to check out to make out flight... which we were late for as there was no wake-up call... no one was working the front desk. I'd say 4 out of 5 times we walked by the front desk no one was there and the lobby was deserted. In my travel experience, this is unacceptable. When you pay this much money ro stay somewhere you expect better service, end of story. As beautiful as it is, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, but bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: mers0021
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding weekend. Overall we had a nice experience but I would not recommend this place to an older crowd. We are a young couple so we don't mind noise, but this place was so loud, you had no chance of good sleep unless you wore ear plugs. Once we did that, we were fine. For a person looking to party in the Gaslamp District, The Keating is in the prime location. We never had to walk more than a block or two to find good food. The only other negative for us was the shower. It is in your main room and has no door so you better hope you are comfortable with the person you are staying with. It also gets a little chilly being that you are so out in the open. The staff was very nice and accommodating. They placed candles and a bottle of wine in our room on our wedding night. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer service!”
Reviews.Author: jerugg
Reviews.Content: Quite unique and eccentric. It's conveniently located in the middle of the Gas Lamp District, possesses historical charm, and has a fabulous staff. Overall I thought it was great. On the downside though it was minimal to me it can be a little loud due to street noise, parking can be a bit of an issue and not everyone is going to like the room set up as everything is completely open except the toilet. I thought those things added to the overall experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyPanther
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I liked the style of the room, especially the shower and sink fixtures - very sleek and modern. I loved having a shower from the ceiling. There was also a wand to use and one could use both at the same time, which is not always possible. There was even a warm fuzzy bath mat and a warm robe and slippers. The pull out closet was fun, The staff was super friendly and concerned that I was happy and having a good time. It was wonderful having an expresso machine (with complementary expresso each day) in the room and I always love free wi-fi. The cookies at bedtime made it perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Central, & Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: Aurora627
Reviews.Content: We love to stay in boutique hotels, so naturally, we picked The Keating. It was extremely trendy and still comfortable. It is not a huge hotel, so it is very easy to get from the lobby to your room. The customer service is amazing! The hotel staff do everything from check you in to valet your car. Parking is extremely limited, so you have to pay $32/day to valet. But the friendliness of the staff helps you forget that. Rooms are awesome! Extremely modern. Shower water comes from the ceiling. Loved it! Sound system is fabulous. Even the hallways were impressive! Hotel is also in the middle of everything! A+

Reviews.Title: “where customer service still exists!”
Reviews.Author: hconcannon
Reviews.Content: As a San Diego, North County, resident, I recently had the opportunity to secure a "staycation" room for my sisters 40th birthday. I researched hotels downtown San Diego & was looking for something different. I came across the Keating & thought it looked like a very hip place to celebrate a special occasion. After bouncing the idea off my friends, they all confirmed that the Keating was the place to be: with its location, incredible service, ambience, & attention to detail -not to mention the after hours bar/club-it seemed to be just what I was looking for. Unfortunately, when I tried to book a room I repeatedly received a busy signal, for over an hr. I was not impressed. Especially in this economic climate. I was so not impressed that I sent an email to Christos Brooks the Reservations Supervisor at The Keating Hotel. The VERY NEXT DAY he sent me an email with an apology stating that: We, at the The Keating, pride ourselves on our level of Personalized Service and attention to detail, and that he was very disappointed to hear the difficulty I experienced while attempting to make my reservation. Furthermore he was unsure as to why I would receive a busy signal, as the phones are monitored around the clock. He further went on to say for me to reach a busy signal for over an hour is unacceptable (way to validate the customer!!!) and that he was currently investigating what happened. Turned out that during that evening there was a phone outage in the area for approximately 2 hours. Christos extendedy an invitation to come check-out the Keating and to please contact him directly for my reservation for a complimentary upgrade to the Keatings penthouse level. I stuck with my instincts, & friends assurance, & booked a room. My sister arrived at the Keating sat afternoon March 13th and was wonderfully surprised with the penthouse! She felt so special & loved! She had a fabulous 40th bday & had nothing but praise for the hotel and the staff. looks like we found our new "go to" place!!!! Next time its my turn-and I will choose the Keating! thank you Christos. You have restored my faith in customer service. It is alive & well at the Keating in San diego!

Reviews.Title: “High Style in San Diego - felt like a millionaire!”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay somewhere to feel like a millionaire or a movie star or to impress that special someone, this is the place. It's the first hotel designed by Pininfarina, who designs Ferraris... so needless to say the design is ultra-cool. Rooms are huge and plush, and location is perfect. Restaurant is great too. Staff very down to earth, no attitude. I will go back as much as I can... because of the Keating, I no longer think of San Diego as a beach-bum city...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Cosy”
Reviews.Author: MaHTheHague
Reviews.Content: I have been to The Keating to spend the New Year 's Eve, and stayed 3 nights with my husband in their best Penthouse ! (Super Morpghosis Jacuzzi !!! - which they prepare for you if you asked them...!!!) The stay was perfect, exactly what I was hoping for : a very trendy, chic (but not boring), and high quality services hotel. Everything is beautiful, and staying at The Keating was a wonderful experience in itself !!! I loved the decoration and atmosphere there ! If I could, I would definitely have stay way longer !!! In addition, the restaurant is very good as well ! Well : 10/10 ! I hope I can go back very soon !!! M.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: tlcrn
Reviews.Content: The Keating is a hip, little hotel in an old building built in 1890 , and is very well located. The location couldn't be better. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, shopping, Petco Park, and the trolley to take you to Old Town or Qualcom Stadium. The hotel is decorated very hip and modern. I like that. Since the hotel is so small. the staff gets to know you quite quickly, and they all seemed to be very nice and helpful. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. Fabulous. Okay, so here goes the negative. At night it is extremely noisy due to the fabulous location near all the bars coupled with the fact that it is an old building with really old windows that do almost nothing to filter out the noise. We were kept up by partiers, sirens, horns, and at 4:20 am by workers power washing the sidewalks. I recommend earplugs and this could have been easily remedied. I think the hotel should put earplugs in each room. Nice touch. The bathroom is not a great one if you are in a new relationship and not completely comfortable with one another. Toilet room doesn't completely shut and you can hear everything that goes on in there, if you know what I mean. Shower doesn't have a door and the water did not get hot enough. Entire sink and shower is open to room. No privacy, but very cool. There is a cool espresso machine in the room, that we couldn't figure out how to use. We are a little slow, though. But, how bout a good old coffee machine. You can call down to the desk to get some coffee, but since it is a small hotel, they don't have an extensive staff, so it may take a while. There is a Starbucks right on the corner, as well. I'm just lazy and didn't want to get up yet. As I am writing this, I just got coffee brought up to the room. The woman delivering the coffee was delightful, the coffee is hot and delicious, and they threw in a couple of pastries. Yep, I'll come back here again soon, with my earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing design but not an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: UNLVclan2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel mid July and I have to say when I arrived I was a bit confused of why there was a dive bar right next door to the hotel entrance to top it of there were about 5 people smoking cigarettes out on the patio which caused my whole body to smell like smoke (so much for a non smoking hotel). When I finally walked into the lobby I was greeted by a front desk employee and the front desk manager which tried to make a smart comment justifying the fact that they have people smoking right next door to their "luxurious" hotel entrance which I didn't buy at all. Ten minutes after I was finally in my room which was an awesome designed room with really unique amenities such as the robes, universal cell phone charger and my favorite the bed! After I checked in I came down to ask a few questions about the area. The front desk guy was very knowledgeable of all the happenings in the whole city, he let me know what restaurants, attractions, stores, bars, clubs, that I should and should not go to (he was the best at planning my whole vacation THANKS YOU!) He mentioned their lounge downstairs would let me in at no cost or wait as long as I mentioned I was staying at the hotel. I soon realized that what he told me was 100% false (my nightmare starts here) after a long day of enjoying the city I wanted to have some fun so I walked down to the lounge around 9:45 10:00 pm just to be greeted by the worst bouncer ever. I nicely let the bouncer know that I was staying at the hotel and he completely ignored me and brushed me off, I felt like I was just another guy off the street not a hotel guest. I tried a different guy who quickly replied "sir your going to have to wait your turn" when there were no more than 10 people waiting in front. I then realized that what was said to me earlier was just a selling tactic... I walked over to another lounge/ club right across the street which had a line 20 times longer and it took no more than 5 minutes to get let in (now I see why every night I walked by the hotels lounge there were more employees than customers waiting) the next morning I mentioned this incident to the same manager that was there when I checked in and all she had to say was " I do apologize I will talk to the lounge manager" which made me wonder if that would solve anything. I saw her a few more times that day and she never followed up with me not once. Once again I felt like no one in management cared. The front desk employees showed more concern than anyone else (which is really sad). Anyways the last thing I experienced was a roach walking around in my room when I came home from a long day at the zoo. I know it is downtown however I wonder how many other times a guest has encountered this problem? It disgusted me in every way shape and form, thank god that it was my last night there because I probably would have gone to another hotel because I felt like there were bugs crawling on me the whole time. I just dont understand why such a nice hotel would offer such bad service usually you get it from the employees not management? You can totally tell that the manager has not been in the business long enough to run a hotel. I hope she is not the only person making executive decisions. With all this being said as I have read other reviews im not the only one who has experienced horrible things at this hotel. If things ever change around there please advertise it so I can give you guys another shot I truly think that this place can be a wonderful place to stay and enjoy a vacation... Its not the hotel that needs a face lift its peoples attitudes and thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “The sound of the ocean in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Praino
Reviews.Content: The Keating is a gorgeous old hotel recently updated with modern design and ammenities. Our room was a 4th floor corner studio layout, but despite it being all one room it was extremely spacious. The bed was the single most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and combined with the 'ocean waves' button on the alarm clock radio it became nearly impossible to get up in the morning if the shades were drawn. The layout is very modern with multiple lounging areas throughout the room and very up to date appliances such as a flat screen tv, surround sound stereo and my personal favorite your very own espresso machine. Being a surfer and all-around beach bum the downtown location didn't seem like it'd be a good fit, but it's central loacation made it very easy to get to a variety of different beaches in the area very easily with just a quick car ride. Come evening it was a short walk to all the bars, clubs, lounges and restaurants in the area as well as Petco Park should you catch a ballgame while you're in town. Overall my girlfriend and I had a wonderful, relaxing and romantic long weekend at The Keating and would recommend it to couples and singles alike. Be sure to check out the rockin' Irish bar and music club next door if you're looking for a little excitement on your way to or from your evening out on the town. And don't forget to hit that 'ocean waves' button on the radio before bed...just as long as you've got nothing to get up for in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place ... if you don't need to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: onspecial Posted by a Luxury Link traveler
Reviews.Content: The Keating has a great location, nice staff and our hotel suite had plenty of room to move around. We had a great stroll in the Gas Lamp District, wonderful dinner at Kroces and settle in to watch a PPV movie and enjoy a glass of wine. At 10 PM a band at a nightclub, below our room begin to play ... and it did not stop. At 1 AM the staff move us up two floors and although the vibration of the drums and guitars became less, you could still hear the music and the people. At 6 AM the next morning the trash truck awoke us with the beautful sound of bottles breaking. We strategically planned our next night, went for dinner a little later, took two Excedrin PMs AND used complimentary ear plugs (hmmm wonder why they supply these). If you are planning a relaxing getaway with plenty of sleep ... this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Our kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 619Family
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take the kids for a fun getaway downtown. We decided on the Keating because of the location and cool design. Our son loves racecars so this place was a dream. Each floor has a replica Ferrari in the hallway. The bathtub is even the same design as a Ferrari's rearview mirror. We spent the day downtown and at Seaport Village. In the evening we took the kids to their first night movie at the Gaslamp Theaters and had dinner at The Merk downstairs. I had the most amazing swordfish and my kids LOVED the pizza. We plan on staying at the Keating again this summer. It's such a great location! We also loved the wonderful bed and amazing shower!

Reviews.Title: “pretty awful”
Reviews.Author: jorgio
Reviews.Content: This place is all appearance and no substance. Good to take picture for a designer magazine but nothing else. And a bad concept of design, in fact, which no thought given to the purpose and the positioning of the furniture. The end result is an uncorfortable room. The staff seems to have little idea of what their job is about. The Gaslamp district is central but very noisy all night. Room prices are just madness. Quite simply not suited for tourists or business travellers

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: suzieSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Do not get the "prepaid rate". I did that on the Internet and when I cancelled my reservation I was not told I would not receive a refund. If I had known that I would have rescheduled. Staff are young and uninformed. Ambiguious Internet information....one page says "prepaid" and the next says "no penality for 72 cancellation notice". Total rip off and I have since heard that it's dirty and noisey. DON'T STAY HERE. Go to the IVY if you desire fun atmosphere or to the Westgate for quiet stay and classy Staff.

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: Vacubcaquix
Reviews.Content: Awful, rude service - small uncomfortable rooms - this nonsense about "modern open design" just means your bed is in your bathroom! The location seems great - but the Gaslamp district is unbelievably noisy all night - with loud garbage trucks in the wee hours - every morning. Also more expensive than a luxury hotel in New York! Unreal prices! If you're into torture and punishment - if you're into being fleeced - then this is the place for you - otherwise, steer clear. The worst clip joint I have ever seen, and I have traveled all over the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DGTravelerSD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a reomantic getaway and chose The Keating. Boy, were we happy with our decision! Our stay was exceptional. The location couldn't be any better - a block in any direction to Horton Plaza, great bars and restaurants, etc. We were right in the middle of the Gaslamp. The staff was very professional and friendly. The rooms were uber-modern with a bed to die for - we slept for 10 hrs straight! Don't let the outside fool you - this is truly a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: hdp123
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Keating was awful. They moved us from the first room because we found cockroaches in the alarm clock, of all places. The second room was bug free, but there were still problems.
