Our room key didn't work 80% of the time and there is only one elevator, so going up and down four flights of stairs every time we needed to get into the room was a hassle. Also, the shower water was luke warm and it is very noisy. We kind of expected a one night room comp because of the roaches, and were instead given dinner at their mediocre restaraunt. We will not be returning to the Keating.

Reviews.Title: “Car Was Stolen”
Reviews.Author: KrysDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Keating, which made the Conde Nast "Hot List for 2008", in June for 1 night. After returning from dinner that evening we locked our rental car and handed the keys to the valet. The next morning we called down to have our car brought up from valet. After 30 minutes our car was no where to be found. We had a flight to catch so the front desk manager offered to call us a cab and "generously" offered to credit our bill for the overnight valet charge. On the way to the airport we reported the car stolen to Hertz who then contacted the hotel management and filed a stolen car report with the police. Less than 48 hours later they located the car. There was $350.00 damage and our camera was missing. Hertz has tried for the last 5 months to get the hotel and/or valet company to pay for the damages. Finally in December Hertz gave up and notified us that we were responsible for the charges. Which we paid. In my conversations with the Keating the manager, Sandra Beavas, she informed me that it was Sunset Valet's responsibility and not the hotels. Even though the hotel charges guests an overnight valet fee. They didn't even offer to pay for our cab ride to the airport. I think the Keating is so caught up trying to being hip that they have forgotten the basics of service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Visit at The Keating”
Reviews.Author: OCCouple2004
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great hotel. The location is perfect, located right in Gaslamp, walking distance to everything; Horton Plaza, Seaport Village, Bars, Restaurants, Little Italy, etc. The hotel is very chic and clean, the bed was very comfortable, the shower was heavenly. The staff was very helpful. Like some of the previous reviews, you do hear the street/ bar noise... thats pretty unavoidable in Gaslamp. If you like a small botique hotel in the city, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Speir
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, I was somewhat reticent to stay at the Keating, but I am quite glad to report that the criticisms levied against the Keating here are a bit overwrought. The primary negative of this hotel, or any hotel in the Gaslamp District, is that you are at Ground Zero of the San Diego social scene. With that comes noise and crowds of people, but the U.S. Grant, Ivy, and Sofia all have similar problems (or worse). As for the hotel itself, the hotel is uber cool (designed by Ferrari designer Pininfarina), with custom designed furniture and room elements in each room and Bang & Olufsen electronics. Rooms are comfortable but spartan, as would befit a Pininfarina remake of a hotel built in 1890. The bed was one of the best I have ever experienced in a hotel. The room floor was painted concrete, and the shower was exposed (with no curtain - by design), but the girlfriend and I found the room to be both comfortable and charming. As would befit a 4 star hotel, the hotel staff was tremendous - eager to help and extremely responsive. We got extremely accurate recommendations on local restaurants and watering holes. The downstairs bar (Minus One) is a nice perk of the Hotel, as admission is guaranteed to guests and the bar turns out to be one of the "go to" spots late night (after 1 a.m.), after other Gaslamp establishments go to last call. All in all, a great stay, and we would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: AZTRAVEL8R
Reviews.Content: So a friend recommended staying at this new place in downtown San Diego. I haven't been back to San Diego in years, and wow what an experience! Downtown has grown! It is a happening place. Restaurant after restaurant; nightclub after nightclub...This place is booming. We stayed at the Keating, and I was impressed. The hotel was amazing. The service was above and beyond. They do a special turn down service, and left a nice little surprise each night when we returned to our room. It almost reminded me of when I took a cruise, and they wait on you hand and foot. I definitely recommend this place. The Beds! My wife and I both agree, we have not slept like that in years. I have to rave about the beds. Hands down the most comfy bed I have slept in. Really romantic place, great place to get away for the weekend. San Diego has so much to offer, and the staff at the keating were so helpful and nice. Definitely the place to come when visiting San Diego. We did not check out there lounge underneath the hotel, but it seemed really busy. Will have to come back for the whole experience next time.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: lemar59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two fabulous nights at The Keating Hotel in downtown San Diego. We wanted to try something new and different and The Keating really delivered. As soon as we drove up to the front doors we were greeted by the polite and helpful valet who quickly got us to the front desk. We were checked in by a gracious staff member then personally escorted to our suite on the 5th floor. The suite has fantastic views of the Gaslamp District and beyond. It was decorated very chic and modern with a sexy feel to it. Clean lines, bold colors, neat as a pin and stocked with all the amenities a couple could want. We were thrilled! As we headed off to dinner we expressed slight disappointment that the lounge/night club was closed Sun. and Mon. nights (we knew this in advance). The staff gave us great options for cocktails and dining all within walking distance of The Keating. Our pre-dinner stop was a wine bar across the street which was lovely and had great wine. Dinner was at Donovan's which we absolutely loved. Great food! Upon returning to our room at The Keating we found a bottle of champagne and strawberries with a note from the management. They wanted us to enjoy our stay and were sorry we did not get to experience their lounge. Once again----We were thrilled! Our stay was topped off with the most comfortable, cozy bed either of us had ever slept on. Pure luxury!! Even though we could hear the buzz of the city below (always to be expected in any downtown area) we drifted off to dreamland quite easily. We feel The Keating is a must if you are visiting downtown San Diego. The beautiful historic building is a wonderful contrast to the ultra modern interior of the hotel. The staff was proffessional, friendly and informative. Thank you Keating for making our mini-vaca a fabulous and comfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Get Ready for Sleepless Nights -- I might as well sleep in the airport!”
Reviews.Author: bdcToronto
Reviews.Content: I went to the Keating in early August. First impression, was WOW what a cool hotel. Gadgets galore very swanky! The room smelt musty as the shower was open concept. (it was right in front of the bed). A great place for voyeurs but not two buddys traveling together. The hotel is in a great location right in the heart of the GASLAMP distrcict. The breakfast was awful! Stale muffins, outdated yogurt and ripened bananas. My biggest quam was the singled paneled windows. I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and had 3 TERRIBLE sleeps. You are right beside a bar and the music is blarring. You can hear everything. They gave earplugs with the room --- now I see why. With this hotel you sacrifice a good night's sleep with swanky rooms and locaton. Staff was great and friendly. Overall, a negative experience.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEPLESS in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: HAMToronto
Reviews.Content: The Keating Hotel is loud! While the minimalist design is breathtaking, and its hi tech in-room gadgets are wonderful, nothing is worth the noise that you will encounter when you chose to stay at this hotel. The hotel upgraded us to the Imperial room, which was large and beautiful, with its high ceilings, large windows and plasma TV's. The room design definitely had its flaws which included an amazing shower that leaked all over the floor, and a misplaced plasma that blocked the washroom, but was beautiful nonetheless. While the Keating appears to be a modernists dream, it is not until you try to fall asleep that you realize you will be dreaming of nothing as sleep is hard to come by.We are a young couple, we go out and we understand what the area is about . I understand hearing outside noises, especially when you chose to stay in the Gaslamp district...this is expected. What is not is the vibrations and loud beats that could be heard through the floor and windows that not only kept us awake but literally shook our bed. After calling down to ask what time the bar closes, after calling a second time to see if anything could be done, after putting in the provided earplugs (isn't that a really bad sign), still no relief!!! It felt as though we were lying inside the bar (the bed is super comfy, but who cares if you can't sleep). This hotel has a major noise problem and they don't really seem to care! After complaining upon checkout we were pretty much told that it was our decision to stay at the hotel. We were also told that it was the Gaslamp district (no apologies). After asking to speak with the manager we were told that we were checking out too early and she would not be in until later. After calling the manager we were told that there was nothing she could do before talking to accounting, AND after waiting for her to call us back....well, we are still waiting. BOTTOM LINE, this hotel is NOISY and not worth your money. Some of the staff are very nice but are very inexperienced in hospitality. Valet service is fine, a bit slow, and other than valet I'm not really sure of any other services because we were not told about them.SAVE YOUR MONEY AND YOUR AGGRAVATION, THIS HOTEL IS NOT WORTH IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: MrsKD
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Keating on a Saturday night. First impressions were wow, what a fab room, we were upgraded to a Suite which was modern Italian in design, open plan. Very comfortable bed indeed, nice high ceilings and lots of gadgets. I felt after being there a while that so much emphasis was put on the high tech this n that, that basic comforts were lacking. For example I went to put on their nice robe from the closet and it was still wet inside the arms, The radio didn't work, scale in the bathroom didn't work. We were right above the hotel bar downstairs, very loud until about 3 am. Luckily we had been out til very late anyway and you need to be if you stay at this hotel. so as not to make you grumpy with all the noise. Nice expresso machine, but no tea on offer or cream for the coffee for those who may like cream so I had to go searching for some in the morning. Found the breakfast room, lovely big room with huge windows and there in the corner a small little table with stale poppyseed muffins, a few stale pastries, some very over ripe bananas. Coffee & Juice. They could do so much with that room by offering fresh croissant, cereals, tea, fresh fruit , newspapers etc. and for a "Luxury Boutique Hotel" breakfast was worse than I have ever had at a Budget Hotel. Such a shame and such a lovely room!!. There was a mix up on our bill and it took about 20 mins for the staff to figure out how to use the computer system to erase the charge and fix it. The staff were very friendly and polite but they need to take care of the basics and forget about how many features the expresso machine has. Hopefully these are teething probs that will remedy in time and make the hotel really worthy of calling itself a Luxury Boutique Hotel. "Mr Tiki" across the road had great food and atmosphere. We went to "The Field" Irish pub for a really nice Irish breakfast, yummy!!

Reviews.Title: “RIDICULOUS NOISE! Rock club located below.”
Reviews.Author: ppprs1
Reviews.Content: The weird design is pointless because there is a rock club directly below the hotel and it is STUPID LOUD. I couldn't even attempt to sleep until they stopped after midnight. I mean, it was like trying to sleep in a rock club bathroom. It was literally that loud. And when i complained? they offered earplugs. It's a common complaint they later admitted, yet despite the insane price for the room, they only offered to knock off a few drink charges. Just ridiculous. I've been in a lot of much nicer and much more expensive hotels. I dont mind paying money for quality. I do mind paying it for a room i can't even freaking SLEEP in. And the worst part is they clearly know about this problem but are just choosing to ignore it.

Reviews.Title: “Not For The Timid or Faint of Heart”
Reviews.Author: omegaet
Reviews.Content: TWO MAJOR POINTS: (1)The Keating IS NOT for everyone! (2)The Keating IS PERECT for those who know what they want! We spent three unbelievable evenings at The Keating and loved every nuance of the experience. After reading some of the prior reviews, we did approach the hotel with some caution…after all, “no shower doors” & “water on the floor” and not enjoying “quiet evenings.” Stay out of Gaslamp Quarter, if you are in search of “quiet”…. try an assisted care living center for senior citizens…”lights out at 9:00 PM and no talking.” If you get a bit of water on the floor…call your personal concierge…maybe it will be Christy or Anji… and they will have someone deliver your extra towels and take care of the wet floor……we know, we did! Don’t waste your money on a Stanze Vista….split with the extra bucks and go for at least a “Chic” or “Imperiale.” The in-room coffee maker is top of the line…get extra canisters…you will covet the espresso! Pay attention during the in-room check-in process and ask questions if you don’t understand how the remotes work…everything has a remote! Spend at least some time in the Minus-1 Lounge…great bar staff (check out the Vault)….the atmosphere and crowd starts picking up around mid-night. They also make it simple to figure out the difference between the Women’s Room and the Men’s Room. Love that special Keating Naughty or Nice package….black silk pajamas, etc., etc…..wait ‘till you see what the “turn down” crew does to your room to make your evening memorable! Someone previously mentioned the “in room massage”…..that’s a must do! btw…when the street noise starts getting a little loud after 1:30 AM….get dressed and go out and join the fun on 5th Ave….be part of the problem…worry about the solution when you get home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Akitty
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. I hope they open more around the world. I will def. come back boutique is the new thing!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HLBSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible! The people working there are very RUDE! I would never go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: NYCjap
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, at first i was a bit hesitant if I made the right decision booking the Keating for my stay. Looking at it from the outside, I thought I was getting one of these old hotels where the furniture hasn't been updated for 50 years, but it was totally the opposite. The hotel is a true diamond in the ruff. The service was great, the rooms were fantastic and all the details of the hotel tuely made this stay an experiece I will never forget. The bed has to be the most comfotable bed I have ever slept in, the only down side is that you can't buy the bed yet, they told me by the end of summer it will be available to purchase. This will be the only hotel I stay at when I return to San Diego! The staff truely went above and beyond what they needed to do, they even walked me to my restaurant a few blocks away. Everything about the hotel was perfect two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloBunnyBabe
Reviews.Content: Our group of 12 VIP's from our company stayed at the Keating for a business meeting. Upon arrival, each person was greated curbside, by their names even, by the friendly Keating staff. Immediately their luggage was taken to their rooms while they checked them in, and from there it only got better. These VIP's are used to fine hotels and service, yet almost everyone from our group commented that the service was outstanding and attention to detail - impecable. It was like nothing they had experienced before, above and beyond in fact. The management and concierge service was beyond expectations as well. Prior to heading out for dinner and after a long day of meetings, our group wanted to have a drink. The manager went so far as to open the semi-private club (Minus 1, which is located downstairs in the Keating) on a day it's normally closed, for an hour just for us! Besides recommending decadent restaurants in the area for dinner, they went the extra mile and even walked us there so we wouldn't get lost and entertained us along the way. Whenever a minor problem would arise, they immediately would handle it and be solved to our satisfaction. I loved the Keating as did the majority of our group. It's very sleak, sexy and modern so it may not be everyone's taste but it worth a stay without question! As for those who complained of the noise in these reviews; during the week while we were there it was pretty quiet. If it does get loud, the Keating provides ear plugs and an eye mask in the rooms ammenities to help you sleep. But the GasLamp district is a hub of activity and energy, noise is to expected. The nightlife is outstanding in that neighborhood and beckons to be enjoyed. So perhaps if it does get loud on weekends there, I suggest you go out, have a few glasses of wine, soak up the vitality of the area, then go back to your room and put in the earplugs. You'll sleep just fine! :)

Reviews.Title: “was loved by the Keating and loved them back!”
Reviews.Author: SFNativeTraveller
Reviews.Content: It is rare that I am impressed by hotel service these days. I have lowered my expectations given the lack of service in general in the hotel industry. So I was completely taken aback at the truly outstanding service my girlfriend and I recently received at the Keating. The staff is so cheerful and helpful and the rooms are to die for! I know this is a little silly but we were both craving In & Out and our personnal conceirge actually went out and got our order! We felt like royalty. Thanks Keating!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bigb702
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Keating Hotel. I found the rooms to be quite comfortable, spacious , and luxurious. The staff was very professional and accomodating. I highly recommened the The -1 Lounge. The staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Keating!”
Reviews.Author: Christina_Sp
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at The Keating and once again I was sad to say goodbye. This new year's eve I returned to The Keating to ring in 2008 and celebrated one the most memorable New Year's yet! The staff is so cheerful and helpful and the rooms are to die for! The Keating is the perfect blend of old meets new - combing modern sophistication with the Gas lamp District's classic and elegant charm yet it's anything but traditional. The Keating offers personal attention that only a boutique hotel can offer. I was brought to my room by one of the many friendly Keating staff members and when I asked for a good place to eat one of the employees actually walked me to a restaurant nearby! When I returned to my room I was greeted with the Keating's signature "turn-down" reminiscent of an Italian vacation. This time around I decided to give the hotel's four-handed in room massage a try and the result?? I felt like a celebrity! It was amazing! My stays at the Keating are always positive and full of indulgence. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: cwes760
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Keating in November. I was attracted to this location as it is Pinninfarina designed. I usually dont spend this much for a hotel stay but I decided to splurge and I must say I do not regret it one bit. From the moment I pulled up valet was right there to take my door and luggage. The service was very personal. The rooms were amazing and unique, all the employees were very helpful and called me by name. They offered so much service I felt as if I was being pampered. I usually dont shop that high when I look for hotels but I will definately stay here again as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Bad....”
Reviews.Author: URMalak
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel based on its location and after I was told it was a cool, happening place in San Diego's Gas Lamp District. After reading other reviews on this site and being told the same thing by others who have stayed here, to never stay in a room facing the Gas Lamp, I made a room change to an interior room at check-in. The room was sleek, ultra-modern, had great products,no privacy when taking a shower(not a prob for me, but others...)real nice flat panel TV, and quiet at night !! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, although I didnt understand the guy w/the dog in the lobby. The underground bar on Thurs nite was a blast, too ! I really liked this place and would return WITH an interior room !!

Reviews.Title: “Another horror night at the Keating”
Reviews.Author: LeftyKalem
Reviews.Content: I wrote a letter to the owner of this hotel, (something I have NEVER DONE) only to find this sight afterwards and when I read it, I saw that everyone who stayed at this hotel had the same reaction as us. My girlfriend has stayed at the W and found it to have very nice accomodations. Not one thing bad about the stay. She suggested we do the same, until I, unfortunately, made the suggestion that we stay at the Keating for 2 nights because the pictures and description looked appealing from hotels.com. NEVER AGAIN >>>>>>>> Our first night, we spent endless time trying to clean up the water from the shower (with no door) because it got all over our room and I was afraid my girlfriend would slip and hurt herself. The next morning we called for towels, and after 20 minutes, I had to go running up and down the stairs to try and find people to direct us where the towels were. SLEEP ????????? What hotel is in the main district with a bar next door and has single paned windows???? For $300.00 a night (plus 30.00 a night for parking?) At least at the Howard Johnson, you know what to expect and don't mind retrieving your own towels for $55.00 a pop. After we complained to the management upon leaving, all she had to say was, "WELL YOU DECIDED TO STAY HERE". WOW Now that we know better, we decide to not repeat that mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Don't confuse this with the Keating House!!”
Reviews.Author: lololadi
Reviews.Content: We had to quickly reroute our whole trip, due to Hurricane Dean, and should have done more research... We wanted to stay in the Gaslamp Quarter to be near some great restaurants, and more of a social scene. We are not, however, party animals or night owls. So unless you DO plan on staying up all night, I agree with previous guests that it is probably the NOISIEST place I've ever slept in my whole life. We were able to sleep with earplugs, which they ACTUALLY PROVIDED in the same bin as the q-tips. ummmmm...isn't that a bad sign?! I really didn't care that it was designed by the same firm that designed the Maserati. The floors were cold and concrete, and the modern bathroom was so dysfunctional. Not to mention, NOT private!! The desk staff was totally unprofessional, and I saw about 12 different people in 2.5 days. The ONLY saving grace was Stephen, who was adorable- a sweetheart. He made us laugh, after our lack of sleep made us crabby. Overall, poor experience. And the Gaslamp Quarter leaves a bit to be desired. oh well.

Reviews.Title: “An Awful, Noisy Place---Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Double Scrutiny
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while cutesy in its decor, is awful. It is located in the middle of San Diego's hip nightlife section and the noise level is unbearable. There are bars everywhere, with the usual shrieking and loud merriment. As the evening progresses, the drunks get drunker and the noise level louder. Worst of all, the hotel lied to us about the noise level. When we called to book, we specifically inquired about the noise and advised that we wanted---and needed---a quiet room. The managment assured that a quiet room had been reserved and would be held for us. What a joke! Management knew the reserved room was not quiet and it should not have misrepresented that in the face of specific inquiries. In my view, sleeping on a park bench would be quieter. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: MDPCAL
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend trip and chose the Keating because of its location. It is convient to everything in the gaslamp district, but there lies the trouble with this property, the noise. The rooms were very nice, the bed comfortable and the cappuccino maker awesome. The shower was wonderful but no privacy so make sure you like your travel companions. I had an interior room, so did not experience the street noise. I was also on the opposite end as the club. However, my room was right behind the elevator which was the noisiest thing I've ever heard. Very annoying. The staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice at first, then terrible...”
Reviews.Author: the_best_dave_ever
Reviews.Content: On first blush, the Keating is a very nice boutique-y hotel right in the heart of the Gaslamp District (directly across the street from a really good Indian restaurant, btw). Having stayed in some exceptional hotels around the world, I was at first impressed by the modernish, european-ish look of the hotel. But look harder, and it begins to feel like an impression of a european boutique hotel. Not sure if this makes sense, but one is left with the feeling that the hotel is trying waaaaay to hard to be different. The staff could not be more accomodating... very helpful from reservation to check in. Wonderful all aroud. Sounds great, right? What's the problem? The problem is that the hotel is EASILY the LOUDEST hotel I have ever stayed at. The Junior suite we were in was directly above a club that seemed to go on all night long. The bed (a very comfy bed, mind you) was literally bumping along in time to the bass and drums below. (at one point, the band broke into "Shout!"... I thought I was going to pass out on the "Little bit louder now!" call and response). Also, the rooms all face the street as far as I can see, and the Gaslamp is SO LOUD at all hours. Good luck sleeping. And since the building is a historical building, they can't put sound proof windows in (I was told). I cant stress to you HOW LOUD THE NIGHT WAS.... I sound like my parents complaining that 'those whippersnappers were up all night...' but that is what it was like. Neither my wife nor I slept more than two hours, give or take. The rooms provide noise machines for your convenience, but that's like turning on the shower to cover up for the cheers from the Superbowl. Terrible, terrible, terrible... And to add insult to injury, upon complaining to the management, the response I got was: "Well, this is the Gaslamp. It does get loud." No apologies, no nothing. For the price we paid, this was waaaay more than insulting. Ive stayed at MANY other hotels in the Gaslamp and NEVER had this problem. So... if you're going to San Diego and have to stay in the Gaslamp, do yourself a favor. Go to the U.S. Grant or any of the other fine, yet not all tricked out hotels in the area. Trust me... the fancy shower box and plasma tv is not worth your mind-numbing lack of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Like being in Italy.. in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: nirad
Reviews.Content: I wanted something unique for a Romantic weekend in San Diego, so I chose this over the big cookie-cutter chain hotels. If you appreciate modern design, you will love this hotel. The materials, electronics, lighting and bath fixtures are all top of the line. The shower, in particular, is a work of art. It's a large glass box that's open to the room with both a waterfall shower on the ceiling and a hand shower on the wall. Another favorite feature was the in-room cappuccino machine. And the lighting controls are the best of any hotel I have stayed in. The beds and linens are extraordinarily comfortable, and the pull-out wardrobes are both unique and easy to use. The biggest downside to staying here is the noise. If you don't plan to stay up late on weekends, don't stay here. The hotel is located in the busiest part of the gaslamp district, and there are loads of bars and restaurants nearby. For us, a young couple staying for the weekend to visit friends, this was an asset. For older people, this would likely not be the case. I would not recommend this hotel for families.

HotelInfo.Name: The Keating Hotel by Pininfarina
HotelInfo.Address: 432 F Street, San Diego, CA 92101
